channel.title: Welcome to Censored State on Censored State
channel.description: Recent content in Welcome to Censored State on Censored State

item.title: VPNs: Can They Outrun the Censors? What You Need to Know
item.description:
Virtual Private Networks

Virtual Private Networks (VPNs) are one of the most important tools in the fight against online censorship. A VPN can allow an internet user to surf the web with reasonable anonymity, access websites that may be blocked in their country, and sometimes even bypass advances censorship technologies. Because of these and other abilities, citizens of authoritarian regimes can get news, entertainment, and other information otherwise unavailable to them. A VPN, though, is not a panacea, and even the best VPNs have limitations.

item.title: About
item.description: Censored State is a project exploring censorship, surveillance, and digital resistance.

item.title: Circumvention Tools
item.description:
Here are tools and services that help bypass censorship and maintain online privacy.

Circumvention Tools

Tails (Live Linux Operating System)

ProtonVPN

The Tor Browser

Obfs4 (Pluggable transport)

fteproxy (Pluggable transport)

meek (Pluggable transport)

FreeBrowser (A censorship circumvention browser)

Brave Search

Startpage (Search Engine)

Protonmail

Tutamail

Signal Messaging

Threema Messaging

Proton Drive

Tresorit (Secure Storage)

Lantern

Psiphon

Quad9 (Alternate DNS) at IP Address 9.9.9.9

DNSWatch (Alternate DNS) at IP Address 84.200.69.80
